intro: Lichtensteinia obscura, commonly known as the narrow-leafed lichen, is a species of lichen that belongs to the family Parmeliaceae. It is characterized by its dense, crust-like thallus that adheres tightly to rock surfaces, typically in arid or semi-arid environments. The lichen consists of a symbiotic association between a photosynthetic alga and a fungus, which allows it to thrive in nutrient-poor conditions. It is often found on shaded, calcareous substrates and is used as an indicator species for environmental conditions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant organism.
